tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about lice?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, absolutely. In most cases, a Maple doctor can diagnose lice online by asking about your symptoms and observing your condition. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they will be able to diagnose, prescribe appropriate medication, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment.
tab_content.accordion_content: If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest you go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or we’ll deliver it right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Lice are small, parasitic insects that feed on blood. A common misconception is that lice is caused by  poor hygiene, but people with the best self-care and hygiene can also get lice.
tab_content.accordion_content:
Types of lice include:

  • Body lice: Found on clothing and bedding and moves on to skin to feed
  • Head lice: Found in the scalp
  • Pubic lice: Commonly called “crabs”, this lice attaches to the skin and hair of your pubic area

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of lice?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Symptoms can include:

  • Appearance of lice and/or lice eggs (nits) on body hair or the scalp
  • Intense itching
  • Small red bumps on scalp neck, shoulders or pubic area
  • Tickling feeling from movement of hair

You can treat lice at home by lathering your hair with non-prescription shampoo designed for lice treatment (which contains pyrethrin). In some cases, prescription treatments may also be required. Along with using shampoo, you should also make sure all nits are removed and all clothing, bedding, personal items, and furniture are decontaminated by washing them in hot (54 C or 130 F) soapy water  and drying them at high heat. Non-washable items can be sealed in an airtight bag for two weeks and carpets should be vacuumed.
tab_content.accordion_content:
How do I remove nits?

  • You’ll need a steel lice comb and a warm water and vinegar solution
  • Wet hair thoroughly with solution
  • Under bright light comb through sections of the hair
  • Shampoo hair with lice treatment shampoo and repeat treatment 7 days after
